caption.p: Schematic representation of cellular proteostasis mechanisms and its interplay with IAV proteins during infection. During its life cycle, the virus can interfere with several cellular proteostasis-related mechanisms, namely by ( a) inhibiting stress granule formation or taking advantage of autophagosome formation, as well as by ( b) manipulating ubiquitin-proteasome system (UPS)-related proteins to efficiently replicate. Viral proteins are represented underlined.
